command.name: virtual
command.abstract: configure a BGP session as virtual

description.p: This command configures one BGP neighbor as "virtual". A virtual peer is used to feed C-BGP with real BGP messages (see bgp router peer recvbgp_router_peer_recv). A virtual peer does not maintain a BGP session with another BGP router in the simulation. Moreover, the router will not send BGP messages to a virtual peer.

see-also.p: This command is best used in combination with command recvbgp_router_peer_recv to inject real BGP routes in the simulation.
